Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> ok i think i get it, but technically a public hushlist where ppl can subscribe to a mailing list by gathering info from the chain would no longer be possible? (assuming thats how the original paper intended the functionality)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I don't do phone calls with people I don't know personally, please do not ask.

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> @gigamesh

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh good question. The original paper assumed that people find out about hushlists via other people in emails, chats, website links, etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> There would be no easy way to tell just from an explorer or blockchain data, that a certain address is a hushlist

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> There would be no way at all

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> That is the point ðŸ™‚

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So going z2z doesn't really affect how 99.9% of people will use stuff

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and now with zaddr sapling viewkeys, we can implement stuff without sending to a taddr

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the original hushlists paper had a use case about doing a z=>t, and tying that together with proof that you own that taddr

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we don do similar things now, avoiding the z=>t

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> thx duke that's interesting, i had thought that the hush explorer would have an API allowing info about "public hushlists" to be indexed by human readable names. the handing over of a viewkey seems like an extra step to creating a similar, but subtly different tech

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh no human readable names, hushlists are known by their zaddr or viewkey

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Human readable names are metadata to be tracked and tie you to other addresses. That is for Verus and stuff, we think that is a bug not a feature

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh sending to a hushlist only requires knowing a zaddr

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> the 3rd party  scraping the explorer would have created a list of human readable names attached to known addresses. in any case ill re-read the original z>t use case

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the original use cases which required doing a z=>t can be done in other ways now, is the TLDR. Viewing keys allow for many amazing things

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Viewing keys are what will power zatomicDEX

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> without them, it's not possible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh you are right that a chain analysis company could scrape the public web for public hushlist data and give human readable names/tags to stuff such as "exchange", "pool", "CEXshit.com", etc...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this is why private Hush smartchains are important, that have no public metadata anywhere on the public internet
